node.title: CNN Fires Chris Cuomo After New Details on Help He Gave His Brother
node.alt: Chris Cuomo, the top-rated anchor at CNN, had built a successful broadcast career outside of his famed political family.
node.description: “We retained a respected law firm to conduct the review, and have terminated him, effective immediately,” the cable network said on Saturday.
node.content: ["The star anchor Chris Cuomo was fired by CNN on Saturday amid a network inquiry into his efforts to help his brother, Andrew M. Cuomo, then the governor of New York, fight off a sexual harassment scandal.", "\u201cChris Cuomo was suspended earlier this week pending further evaluation of new information that came to light about his involvement with his brother\u2019s defense,\u201d CNN said in a statement on Saturday. \u201cWe retained a respected law firm to conduct the review, and have terminated him, effective immediately. While in the process of that review, additional information has come to light. Despite the termination, we will investigate as appropriate.\u201d", "The announcement completed a stunning downfall for Chris Cuomo, the top-rated anchor at CNN and a veteran television journalist who had built a successful broadcast career outside of his famed political family. Until last month, Mr. Cuomo had enjoyed the support of CNN\u2019s president, Jeff Zucker, and faced no discipline for his behind-the-scenes strategizing with Andrew Cuomo\u2019s political aides, a breach of basic journalistic norms.", "But a new batch of testimony and text messages released by the New York attorney general on Nov. 29 revealed that the CNN anchor had played a more intimate and engaged role in his brother\u2019s political affairs than the network said it had previously known. CNN executives, previously steadfast in backing Mr. Cuomo, placed him on indefinite suspension on Tuesday, a sign of deep unease among the network\u2019s management.", "The spectacle of a high-profile cable news anchor advising his powerful politician brother amid scandal was a longstanding headache for many CNN journalists, who privately expressed discomfort at actions that, in their view, compromised the network\u2019s credibility. The CNN anchor Jake Tapper went public with his concerns in May, telling The New York Times that his colleague had \u201cput us in a bad spot,\u201d adding, \u201cI cannot imagine a world in which anybody in journalism thinks that that was appropriate.\u201d", "Mr. Zucker, for a time at least, had stood behind Mr. Cuomo, saying the anchor was \u201chuman\u201d and facing \u201cvery unique circumstances.\u201d The network also offered the anchor a formal leave if he wished to work more closely with his brother\u2019s team. ", "In the wake of Chris Cuomo\u2019s suspension on Tuesday, CNN said it would embark on an internal review of his conduct, but the network made no immediate plans to retain an outside law firm or forensic investigators. The review was expected to focus on what ethical journalistic lines Mr. Cuomo may have crossed, according to a person familiar with the network\u2019s plans. ", "Mr. Cuomo, previously at ABC News, was one of CNN\u2019s first major hires after Mr. Zucker became its president in 2013. A morning show, \u201cNew Day,\u201d was organized in part around Mr. Cuomo\u2019s bombastic, fast-talking on-air personality. Mr. Cuomo also brought reportorial experience from his time covering wildfires, shooting rampages and war zones.", "He moved to prime-time in 2018, beating out other prominent hosts like Mr. Tapper to take over the coveted 9 p.m. slot at the network. \u201cCuomo Prime Time\u201d became CNN\u2019s highest-rated hour, although it regularly attracted fewer viewers than competitors on Fox News and MSNBC.", "The blurred ethical lines of the Cuomos\u2019 relationship became apparent almost immediately: In 2013, the network was criticized after Chris Cuomo twice interviewed his brother on \u201cNew Day.\u201d", "But CNN embraced the brothers\u2019 on-air relationship at the onset of the pandemic, when Chris Cuomo, who contracted Covid, broadcast his show from quarantine in the basement of his Long Island home. Andrew Cuomo joined several times for highly-rated emotional conversations, which Mr. Zucker praised for their \u201cauthenticity and relatability and vulnerability.\u201d", "\u201cThat\u2019s what the brothers Cuomo are giving us right now,\u201d Mr. Zucker told The Times in April 2020.", "The next year, as Andrew Cuomo was facing a growing number of sexual harassment accusations, Chris Cuomo recused himself from reporting on the scandal, leaving a prime-time hole in CNN\u2019s coverage of what was turning out to be a national news story. At the same time, away from the anchor desk, Chris Cuomo was participating in strategy sessions with Andrew Cuomo\u2019s top aides."]
